page.title: 01Rural and Urban Thornton
page.content: This area is one of the larger and more sparsely populated localities in the Bradford Metropolitan District, having 15,567 people. Outside the two main residential centres, the area is mainly agricultural land reaching a height of 1,300 feet. The farming land has many small groups of houses which are well known for their unusual names viz: Moscow, Egypt, Jerusalem, Worlds End. The village of Thornton was formally an important textile centre but is now mainly residential. It was the birthplace of the Bronte sisters and their father was the village curate. The other main residential suburb, Allerton, was formerly a substantial village but has since been extended by a large Local Council Housing Estate.
